content.introduction:
Warns when a forwarding reference parameter is not forwarded inside the
function body.

Example:

template
 
<
class
 
T
>


void
 
wrapper
(
T
&&
 
t
)
 
{


  
impl
(
std
::
forward
<
T
>
(
t
),
 
1
,
 
2
);
 
// Correct


}

<
class
 
T
>


void
 
wrapper2
(
T
&&
 
t
)
 
{


  
impl
(
t
,
 
1
,
 
2
);
 
// Oops - should use std::forward<T>(t)


}

<
class
 
T
>


void
 
wrapper3
(
T
&&
 
t
)
 
{


  
impl
(
std
::
move
(
t
),
 
1
,
 
2
);
 
// Also buggy - should use std::forward<T>(t)


}

<
class
 
F
>


void
 
wrapper_function

f

std
::
forward
<
F
>

,
